intro: Draba oreades proles chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese rock cress, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of China. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Draba oreades proles chinensis is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas with limited vegetation.
